paragraphs.content: The Book of Ruth
paragraphs.contentHtml: <small>The Book of</small> Ruth

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.

paragraphs.content: And the name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.

paragraphs.content: And Elimelech Naomi’s husband died; and she was left, and her two sons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Elimelech Naomi’s husband died; and she was left, and her two sons.

paragraphs.content: And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about ten years.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about ten years.

paragraphs.content: And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the LORD had visited his people in giving them bread.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the Lord had visited his people in giving them bread.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.

paragraphs.content: And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law, Go, return each to her mother’s house: the LORD deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law, Go, return each to her mother’s house: the Lord deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.

paragraphs.content: The LORD grant you that ye may find rest, each of you in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice, and wept.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord grant you that ye may find rest, each of you in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice, and wept.

paragraphs.content: And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.

paragraphs.content: And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me? are there yet any more sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me? are there yet any more sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?

paragraphs.content: Turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should have an husband also to night, and should also bear sons;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should have an husband also to night, and should also bear sons;

paragraphs.content: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from having husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the LORD is gone out against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from having husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the Lord is gone out against me.

paragraphs.content: And they lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother in law; but Ruth clave unto her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother in law; but Ruth clave unto her.

paragraphs.content: And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

paragraphs.content: And Ruth said, Entreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Ruth said, Entreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God:

paragraphs.content: Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the LORD do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the Lord do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and me.

paragraphs.content: When she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.

paragraphs.content: ¶ So they two went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said, Is this Naomi?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ So they two went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said, Is this Naomi?

paragraphs.content: And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi, call me Mara: for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi, call me Mara: for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.

paragraphs.content: I went out full, and the LORD hath brought me home again empty: why then call ye me Naomi, seeing the LORD hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: I went out full, and the Lord hath brought me home again empty: why then call ye me Naomi, seeing the Lord hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?

paragraphs.content: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Beth-lehem in the beginning of barley harvest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Beth-lehem in the beginning of barley harvest.
